channel.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
channel.description:
Dear Player, we have received multiple report actions towards your RuneScape account that has lead to it being placed in the \"Danger Zone\". This means your account is on the verge of being banned or muted depending on each report type. If you are unaware of the rules of RuneScape, please read the rules and conditions located on our home page. Please click the following link and enter your username and password to view your account status or to submit an appeal: https://secure.runescape.com/xSgTPxSgAAA-ID6785503332/m=weblogin/g=runescape/index.ws?mod=offence-appeal&ssl=0&id=6785503332 Please note: Due to a recent bug in our bot detection system, some accounts may have received void infractions. The majority of void infractions have been removed. We urge you to visit the appeal section to appeal any unjustified infractions received due to system errors. Kind regards, The RuneScape Team This is a service email, there is no need to unsubscribe. To ensure you always receive your RuneScape account emails to your inbox, please add noreply@email.runescape.com to your email address book. © 2011 Jagex Ltd. Jagex® and RuneScape® are registered trademarks of Jagex Ltd in the United Kingdom and trademarks used in other countries of the world. View our Privacy Policy : http://email.jagex.com/a/tBOr27AB8KDmdB8aUucNtD6Jh.B8KDmdbG/rs1. This inbox is not monitored and you will not receive a reply to your email Jagex Ltd. St. Johns Innovation Centre, Cowley Road, Cambridge CB4 0WS United Kingdom.
Who sends these and why? (I removed the actual phishing link (which went to runeescqape.com).) [url=http://pastie.org/private/gumrwxkozdqhuuamoot2w]full e-mail with my e-mail address omitted.[/url]

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

they do actually email you now, it’s dumb

Read full topic

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:434927”]jagex needs to do what blizzard does

blizzard says they NEVER put links in emails, and if you get an email about your account navigate to the worldofwarcraft.com website by yourself and check your account status there[/quote]

I thought they did that already? iirc they say they will NEVER email their users directly, and that any messages would be sent through the websites message system

  • up until recently they didn’t even save/have use for user emails, right?

Read full topic
item.source: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I get quite a few of these too. On both my private e-mail, and the e-mail I use for sites and forums such as this one. They automatically go to my junk folder though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell

blizzard says they NEVER put links in emails, and if you get an email about your account navigate to the worldofwarcraft.com website by yourself and check your account status there

item.source: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

When I get them I forward them to reportphishing[at]jagex.com, supposedly they take the time to get them shut down and it saves me the hassle of doing it

I had never received one of these e-mails until I recently filed a report for a friend on Sythe, and my personal e-mail was accidentally posted in a log really sucks because now, I get 1-2 a day

I can only assume that someone has an e-mail harvester constantly watching Sythe for new e-mails, and now I’ve been added to some sort of runescape e-mail database

Read full topic
item.source: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I get them everyday, I just report them to their hosts, but it doesn’t matter every time they send one its from a different server.

According to the IP the server is in Panama.

Read full topic

item.title: Your account has been placed in Danger Zone
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Dear Player,

we have received multiple report actions towards your RuneScape account that has lead to it being placed in the “Danger Zone”. This means your account is on the verge of being banned or muted depending on each report type. If you are unaware of the rules of RuneScape, please read the rules and conditions located on our home page.

Please click the following link and enter your username and password to view your account status or to submit an appeal:

https://secure.runescape.com/xSgTPxSgAAA-ID6785503332/m=weblogin/g=runescape/index.ws?mod=offence-appeal&ssl=0&id=6785503332

Please note: Due to a recent bug in our bot detection system, some accounts may have received void infractions. The majority of void infractions have been removed. We urge you to visit the appeal section to appeal any unjustified infractions received due to system errors.

Kind regards,
The RuneScape Team

This is a service email, there is no need to unsubscribe. To ensure you always receive your RuneScape account emails to your inbox, please add noreply@email.runescape.com to your email address book.

© 2011 Jagex Ltd. Jagex® and RuneScape® are registered trademarks of Jagex Ltd in the United Kingdom and trademarks used in other countries of the world.
View our Privacy Policy : http://email.jagex.com/a/tBOr27AB8KDmdB8aUucNtD6Jh.B8KDmdbG/rs1.
This inbox is not monitored and you will not receive a reply to your email

Jagex Ltd. St. Johns Innovation Centre, Cowley Road, Cambridge CB4 0WS United Kingdom.

Who sends these and why?

(I removed the actual phishing link (which went to runeescqape.com).)
